intro: Frangula pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's buckthorn, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in the spring. The plant is part of the Rutaceae family, which includes other plants like citrus and buckthorn. Its fruit is a small, reddish drupe that matures in the fall. Frangula pringlei is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
